# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia function that fulfills your requirements:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```

This function works by first converting the column name to lower case, then removing any leading or trailing white spaces from that string. It then replaces all instances of spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[ -]"` is used to match space or hyphen characters.

For instance, calling `clean_column(" My Column ")` will return `"my_column"`.
